Entries.DialogueText: *sniff* sniff* ... that sharp smell!
*slurp* *slurp* ... that zesty taste! That gritty texture!
It can only be gourmet tomato salt! I'll trade you for it.
Oh wow, thank you! I'm tempted to drink all of it, but I'm going to save some for the saloon. I bet I could make an interesting cocktail with this!
*sniff*... Ah. Exquisite cuisine. You know what I like, .
Lewis tells me your tomatoes have ripened. That's great news!
...Just imagine what the culinary world would be like without tomatoes...
Emily has a real pep in her step lately... I wonder why? *wink*
Hey, I'm sorry to hear about the break-up...
If you need company, you're always welcome at the Saloon.
Another failed marriage? Well, it happens. Guess I'll be seeing you at the Saloon more often...
Hey, you really pulled through with those eggs. The omelet turned out great, thanks to you!
It's important to me that people can eat healthy, delicious meals. Unfortunately, in today's world, that's not so easy for everyone.
Hi there, . If you're ever thirsty, the Saloon is the place to be.
I don't actually drink very much myself. I'm mainly doing this to make a living.
Although I do enjoy a taste of the Stardew Valley vintage from time to time.
I saw the weather report last night. It really gave me a scare!
Are there monsters out there? What's happening?
*sniff*... These rains have a particular smell. Have you noticed? Almost like freshly minced herbs...
I'm glad that's over. Running the saloon is enough to worry about, I don't need exotic weather in my life!
Well hello there! I'm Gus, chef and owner of the Stardrop Saloon.
Stop in if you need any refreshments. I've always got hot coffee and cold beer at the ready.
Hey, need a drink? I've got some special beverages that showcase local ingredients from this island.
Hey , just want to say that I'm happy for you and .
Yeah, I know a lot about the people living here.
That's one of the benefits of being a bartender.
Sometimes I hear too much...
Hey. I heard what you did for Pam. That was really really nice of you!
Sadly, I don't think it will get her to cut back on the 'beverages'...
I saw Pam earlier today... she was grinning from ear to ear! She said someone bought her a new house!
Whoever it was, they truly deserve the best!
Meet me at the bar if you need a beverage.
Hey, ! Glad you're here. I'm gonna be serving up some good stuff from behind the bar.
I'll see you back home, .
Welcome to the Stardrop Saloon! Can I get you anything?
Business has been really good tonight. I'm pleased.
Hey, you look like you could use a beverage.
Hi! Please relax and enjoy yourself.
Hi there, . Make yourself at home.
Hi there . I'm glad to see you! You're always welcome here.
Are you much of a chef, ?
If you have a kitchen and some recipes, you can cook some useful dishes.
Home-cooked meals make great gifts, as well.
Hi, Pierre!/Now, what do I need.../Ah, that looks good!/Makin' my special sauce tonight!/Pierre! What's fresh?/Pierre! Waddya got for me?
Business has been pretty steady thanks to my regular customers.
Pam and Clint come into the saloon almost every night.
I'd probably go out of business if they stopped coming.
So make sure you don't drive them away!
Clint comes into the saloon almost every night and sits at the same table by himself.
Sometimes he glances over at Emily with a nervous look. Hmmm.
Maybe that's why he comes in so often. Oh well, that means more business for me.
Pam comes into the saloon almost every night and drinks way too much beer.
Ah well, I shouldn't pass judgment on my customers.
I sell different dishes each week, so make sure and check in every now and then!
You might taste something spectacular.
Just let me know if you have any allergies.
Okay, see you around.
Emily's been working here for a while now. I don't know what I'd do without her!
I would hate to have to clean all those pots by myself.
These might be the best crab cakes I've ever made...
Hooo~... Back at it again, huh Willy?
They look fresh all right...
I'll take the whole lot!
With a discount for the extra labor, of course...
Looks like we got 'em all...
Psst... ... Don't tell Willy, but I'll be doing a special on crab cakes at the saloon for the next few days...
Good morning!
Ah... what a beautiful day, huh?
Well, I'm gonna head home. I gotta get this marinara back on the stove! Have a good one!
You know, as the Saloon owner, I hear about everything that's going on in town.
I remember when you first moved here... everyone was a bit unsure of what to expect.
A stranger from the city... an unknown personality...
Sorry, I have to stir this pot every 5 minutes.
Anyway, what was I saying? Oh yeah... you know, it's like when you're making a sauce...
...If you put in a new spice you could ruin everything!
...But then again, there's always a chance you'll create something new and delicious! Right? Hahahaha.
Er... What I'm trying to say is...
It's been great having you in town, and I've come to think of you as one of my good friends!
Anyway, I came to give you something...
I was cleaning out the back room and I found this old Mini-Jukebox. I want you to have it!
It's actually an old Do-It-Yourself project of mine, from many years ago. They're pretty easy to make!
So, just in case you wanted to make more, I brought the blueprints for you...
One sec...
Received a 'Mini-Jukebox'
Learned how to craft a 'Mini-Jukebox'
Well, folks... once again, we're gathered for a very special occasion.
...A rare visit from a very dear friend...
...My world-famous giant omelet!
Zesty bell pepper, juicy tomato, rich mushroom, and tangy cheese... all enrobed in a blanket of rich, fluffy egg. Dig in, folks.
Willy? What do you think?
Is that a good thing?
Nope... You can thank over at Farm!
I'm having a lot of fun. And it's good for business!
Though maybe not so good for Shane's liver...
Hi. I'll take your order in a few moments.
There you go, sir.
Oh, hello there, buddy.
Hi, .
*sigh*... I'm just looking over last month's earnings... and it's not looking very good, .
The worst thing... and I hate to say this because she's my friend... is Pam! She hasn't paid off her tab in weeks!
...But I can't ask her to do it. I know she'll get defensive, and I don't want to hurt her feelings.
, you gotta help me!
Er... Well, okay Pam.
Thanks, Pam!
And thank you, .
Now, let's get you that drink, Pam.
Thanks for your help, . This cash is going to be a big help to the saloon.
I'm all ears.
That sounds pretty good! I could use some quality veggies for the saloon. How much does it cost?
What was that?
Hahaha... for a moment there, I thought I heard, '25,000g'.
Pierre, are you crazy? There's no way I could afford that. I'd have to sell the saloon!

Entries.DialogueFrom: Event:Town/191393/Hn ccFishTank/Hn ccBulletin/Hn ccPantry/Hn ccVault/Hn ccBoilerRoom/Hn ccCraftsRoom/Hl jojaFishTank/Hl jojaPantry/Hl jojaVault/Hl jojaBoilerRoom/Hl jojaCraftsRoom/Hl JojaMember/w sunny/H
Entries.DialogueText: I still dream of that garlic butter.

Entries.DialogueFrom: Event:Town/191393/Hn ccFishTank/Hn ccBulletin/Hn ccPantry/Hn ccVault/Hn ccBoilerRoom/Hn ccCraftsRoom/Hl jojaFishTank/Hl jojaPantry/Hl jojaVault/Hl jojaBoilerRoom/Hl jojaCraftsRoom/Hl JojaMember/w sunny/H_alt
Entries.DialogueText: Me too!
Wait.
I know what you were doing, Linus.
If you need food... just ask. I don't want anyone in Pelican Town to go hungry.
Here. I've got a basket of zucchini fritters for you. Just make sure you dip them in my spicy marinara!
Go on... take it.
Great stuff!
Nice!
Eat as much as you like! It's all free today... compliments of Mayor Lewis.Oh! Make sure to dribble some of my secret sauce on there.
Working four grills simultaneously is hard work! There's a large and hungry crowd to cater to today.I put a little dash of my zesty sauce in each patty. *wink*
It's a lot of fun to cook with pumpkin. Such an interesting fruit.

Carving pumpkins is a talent of mine. I usually do most of the Jack-O-Lanterns for everyone in town.All I ask in return is to keep the seeds... sprinkle a little cinnamon sugar on those puppies and you've got yourself a golden snack!
I hope everyone's enjoying the food... I've been cooking for days to get everything ready.Fried eggs, boiled eggs, poached eggs, deviled eggs, scrambled eggs, chocolate eggs... you name it!
Shh... don't tell anyone, but I tried something different this year... Duck eggs in the custard!
Frog season is really starting to pick up.
Have you tried the dandelion salad? I prepared it fresh right here!
These blasted sand-flies keep landing on the food!
One bad ingredient can ruin the whole soup...
'Moonlight Jellies'... I wonder how they taste?I would never try it, of course!
*sniff* Ahh... the fresh smell of the ocean never fails to satisfy.

It's a fine art, making candy canes. You've really got to search far and wide for the best ingredients. They aren't easy to come by these days!I usually use Fern Island Ringfruit for my premier canes, you know. You can't beat that bright red coloring... And it's all natural!Oh, you want to know the secret to my deluxe double-canes? Okay, but you've got to promise absolute secrecy. *whisper* It's a drop of vanilla in the white candy to complement the cherry flavor.Of course, peppermint candy canes are the standard, and I always make a healthy batch of those as well.Hey, you look like you're falling asleep. Are you okay?
Eat! Eat, while it's still fresh and hot.I could go on and on about my new method of making candy canes... but I'll spare you the details this year!
Sorry there's no food.Just wait until the Feast of the Winter Star. You'll be stuffed for days.
I've been spending too much time holed up inside, watching Gridball... it's good to get outside in the crisp winter air.
You're giving this... to me? I'm speechless.
Oh, goodness! Are you sure?
No, no, no...
This is absolute junk. I'm offended.
Oh, that's sweet. Thank you.
